name: I Wanna Be On
tag_list: media, entertainment, consulting, internet, production, life-coach, business-coach, empowerment-media
overview:
I Wanna Be OnÂ® launched an innovative personality consulting blog to help people and businesses add some “celebrity” into their reality.

New York, NY (PRWEB) September 14, 2009 – I Wanna Be OnÂ® launched an innovative personality consulting blog to help people and businesses add some “celebrity” into their reality.

Pioneered by Professor Vincent Presti, entertainment attorney and media critic, I Wanna Be OnÂ® expands the scope of its innovative personality consultancy through daily media commentary on its new blog, www.iwannabeon.com, and Twitter, IWannaBeOnMedia. The company works with individuals and businesses, not only as clients, but as production partners, to develop and execute innovative media platforms and projects.

Professor Presti recalls his conversation with Ben Silverman (former co-chairman of NBC Entertainment and Universal Media Studios) who told him, “Know who the players are– otherwise you are no good to me or anyone!” He believes his critical analysis of media trends will inspire individuals and businesses to understand how best to benefit from celebrity trends and their audiences.

What Walt Disney did for family entertainment, I Wanna Be OnÂ® will do for “self-improvement, empowerment media!” Additional I Wanna Be OnÂ® extension franchises will be launching in the next few months, commencing with Jay Leno, Oprah, and Saturday Night Live.

About the Company Founded in 2006, I Wanna Be OnÂ® is a pioneering empowerment media organization. Our first-look deal with CBS Television to develop legal-themed reality programming evolved into an Internet media enterprise focused on helping individuals and businesses improve their daily routines. Our unique brand of “personality consulting” can be applied to any situation as an exercise in imaginative problem-solving.
